alert.note: Alert for Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 11:00PM EST until January 03 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EST FOR LOWNDES COUNTY... At 1100 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lakeland to 8 miles west of Lake Park, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Park, Valdosta, Moody Air Force Base, I-75 At Exit 16, Remerton, Dasher, Naylor, Barretts, Twin Lakes, Valdosta Regional Airport, I-75 At Exit 5, Clyattville and I-75 At Exit 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST for south central Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
